brief_summary.textblock: Osteoarticular infections at pneumococcal are rare, potentially serious and remain under diagnosed. They represent 3 at 10% of the arthritis septic in the literature. 190 cases have been published of 1965 at 2003. They represent 0.3% at 0.6% of the bacteraemia at Streptococcus peumoniae.

primary_outcome.measure: Description and rate of bone or joint infection with S. pneumoniae
primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
primary_outcome.description: Description of the type of infection due to S. pneumoniae : patients and type of implant, profile of the bacterium associated in the infection, medical and chirurgical treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined by local clinical and/or microbiological relapse; and/or need for additional surgery; death of septic origin
